Content:: Warren Frederick Kitzmiller (March 21, 1943 – July 10, 2022) was an American politician who was a member of the Vermont House of Representatives from 2001 to 2022 and was a Democrat. He was appointed to the Vermont General Assembly in 2001, when his wife Karen B. Kitzmiller who served in the Vermont General Assembly, died from cancer. He owned a sports store in Montpelier and served on the Montpelier City Council.[1][2][3] Kitzmiller died following a stroke on July 10, 2022, at the age of 79.[4][5]  This article about a Vermont politician is a stub. You can help Wikipedia by expanding it.
